intro: Parnassia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Saxifragaceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, white or pale blue flowers that often have a distinctive, almost translucent appearance. Parnassia species are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as bogs and meadows. They have simple, alternate leaves that are often waxy and covered in fine hairs. The genus includes around 50 species, many of which are native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
